#macro(begin_examplezone)

#end 1 R2 Skin Macros #warning("In progress...") #toc("" "" "") 1.1 Basic Design Elements 1.1.1 Page title {code} 1 Page title {code} 1.1.1 Headerbar {code} \#titlebar("Title" "Link text" "link" "color") {code} For a titlebar with no link, the link parameter should be empty (i.e. ""). Values for color: red, blue, purple. #begin_examplezone() {code} \#titlebar( "A title" "Text on the right" "Main.WebHome" "blue") {code} generates #titlebar("A title" "Text on the right" "Main.WebHome" "blue") ---- {code} \#titlebar( "W3C Standards" "Go to W3C homepage" "http://www.w3.org" "red") {code} generates #titlebar("W3C Standards" "Go to W3C homepage" "http://www.w3.org" "red") ---- {code} \#titlebar( "Here is the info you need" "" "" "purple") {code} generates #titlebar("Here is the info you need" "" "" "purple") #end_examplezone() 1.1.1 Subheader {code} \#subitlebar("Subtiitle" "Link text" "link" "color") {code} For a subtitlebar with no link, the link parameter should be empty (i.e. ""). Values for color: red, blue, purple. #begin_examplezone() {code} \#subtitlebar( "A title" "Text on the right" "Main.WebHome" "blue") {code} generates #subtitlebar("A title" "Text on the right" "Main.WebHome" "blue") ---- {code} \#subtitlebar( "W3C Standards" "Go to W3C homepage" "http://www.w3.org" "red") {code} generates #subtitlebar("W3C Standards" "Go to W3C homepage" "http://www.w3.org" "red") ---- {code} \#subtitlebar( "Here is the info you need" "" "" "purple") {code} generates #subtitlebar("Here is the info you need" "" "" "purple") #end_examplezone() 1.1.1 SubSubheader {code} 1.1.1.1 subsubheader {code} 1.1.1 Paragraphs 1.1.1.1 With image {code} \#paragraphimg( "type" "image" "imagetitle" "text" "read more link" "read more link text" "source") {code} where: * type can be: "portrait", "logo", "image" * image is the link to the image * imagetitle is an image description (can be empty); it appears as an alternative to the image (the text is displayed when the image is missing; it is also important to have an image description / alternative text for screen readers) * text is the actual text in the paragraph * read more link is the url of the rest of the text (can be empty, in which case the link is not displayed) * read more link text is the text of the link; if it is empty (""), the default text is displayed: "Read more..." * source is the smallprint information about the text (can be empty) #begin_examplezone() {code} \#paragraphimg( "portrait" "http://www.whitehouse.gov/history/presidents/images/al16.jpg" "Abraham Lincoln's portrait" "Lincoln warned ... defend it.'" "http://www.example.com" "" "Some information about the source of the text" ) {code} where the image is referred by full url, generates #paragraphimg( "portrait" "http://www.whitehouse.gov/history/presidents/images/al16.jpg" "Abraham Lincoln's portrait" "Lincoln warned the South in his Inaugural Address: 'In your hands, my dissatisfied fellow countrymen, and not in mine, is the momentous issue of civil war. The government will not assail you.... You have no oath registered in Heaven to destroy the government, while I shall have the most solemn one to preserve, protect and defend it.'" "http://www.example.com" "" "Some information about the source of the text") ---- {code} \#paragraphimg( "logo" \$xwiki.getAttachmentURL("Main.Partners", "xwiki logo.png") "The curriki logo" "The content of the paragraph." "Main.WebHome" "Go to the Curriki web site" "" ) {code} where * the image is named "xwiki logo.png" and it is attached to the "Main.Partners" document * the read more link is an internal link * there is no source info generates: #paragraphimg( "logo" $xwiki.getAttachmentURL("Main.Partners", "xwiki logo.png") "The xiki logo" "The content of the paragraph." "Main.WebHome" "Go to the Curriki web site" "" ) ---- #info("When the image is attached to the current document, it can be simply called by name. In that case, the example above becomes:") {code} \#paragraphimg( "logo" "xwiki logo.png" "The curriki logo" "The content of the paragraph." "Main.WebHome" "Go to the Curriki web site" "" ) {code} #end_examplezone() 1.1.1.1 Without image {code} \#paragraph("text" "readmodelink" "readmore link text") {code} where: * text is the actual content of the paragraph * readmorelink is a link to more information about the subject; it can be: ** empty ("") ** an internal wiki link (such as "Main.Webhome") ** a full url, including the transfer protocol ( "http://"); for example: "http://java.sun.com" * readmore link text is the text of the link; it can be empty, in which case the default text (Read more) is displayed #begin_examplezone() {code} \#paragraph( "This is a simple paragraph just for exemplification." "Main.Contact" "Contact Curriki" ) {code} generates: #paragraph( "This is a simple paragraph just for exemplification." "Main.Contact" "Contact Curriki" ) ---- {code} \#paragraph( "This is a paragraph with default link text." "Main.Contact" "" ) {code} generates: #paragraph( "This is a paragraph with default link text." "Main.Contact" "" ) #end_examplezone() 1.1.1 Buttons {code} \#button("button text" "color" "type" "id" "onclick script") {code} where: * the values for color: red, grey * the values for type: submit, reset (the type will be "submit" if this parameter is "") * onclick script is a string containing the javascript code that should be executed when the button is clicked; this parameter can be empty ("") #begin_examplezone() {code} \#button( "Text on Button1" "grey" "submit" "" "" ) {code} generates: #button( "Text on Button1" "grey" "submit" "" "" ) ---- {code} \#button( "Submit data" "red" "submit" "" "if(confirm('Are you sure you want to submit?')) { alert ('Submit'); return true; } else { alert('Won`t submit'); return false; }" ) {code} generates: #button( "Submit data" "red" "submit" "" "if(confirm('Are you sure you want to submit?')) { alert ('Submit'); return true; } else { alert('Won`t submit'); return false; }" ) («- Click it!) #end_examplezone() 1.1 Home page modules 1.1.1 Module 1 {code} \#home_intro( "image.png" "alternate image text" "Title" "Text text text" "Read More Link" ) {code} #begin_examplezone() The code {code} \#home_intro( "currikihomeimg.png" "An image with two children and a teacher" "The Global Education & Learning Community" "We believe that access to knowledge and learning tools is a basic right for every child. Our goal is to make curricula and learning resources available to everyone." "Main.LearnMore" ) {code} generates the big text & image on top of the [home page>Main.WebHome]. The image must be attaches to that page. If the image is attached to another document, the image field should become similar to {code} \$xwiki.getAttachmentURL("Main.WebHome", "currikihomeimg.png") {code} The image source can also be a full url, such as "http://www.example.com/some_image.png". #end_examplezone() 1.1.1 Module 2: last resources {code} \#home_latest_resources(number "left_title" "right_title" "max description length as string") {code} where: * number denotes how many resources to display * left_title and right_title are th texts in the titlebar; if these strings are empty, the default titles are used (see in the example below) * max description length as string is the number of characters to be displayed for each resource; if this paraneter is "", the default value is used. #begin_examplezone() {code} \#home_latest_resources(4 "" "" "") {code} (with default texts and description lengths) generates:
#home_latest_resources(4 "" "" "")
---- {code} \#home_latest_resources( 4 "Most recent stuff" "Follow this link to see all of it" "15" ) {code} generates
#home_latest_resources( 4 "Most recent stuff" "Follow this link to see all of it" "15" )
#end_examplezone() 1.1.1 Module 3: featured content {code} \#home_featured_content( \[ \["fhsst", "Demo.fhsstChapters"], \["wlc" , "Demo.DigitalStoryTelling"] \] ) {code} {code} \#featured_content_item("title" "text" "fulltextlink") {code} #begin_examplezone() {code} \#titlebar( "Featured Content" "Go to the featured content section" "Main.FeaturedContent" "red" ) \#featured_content_item( "Free High School Science Texts" "FHSST has posted segments of their open source science and mathematics textbooks for Grades 10 - 12 on Curriki. These books are the creations of a South Africa-based world-wide open source community." "Demo.fhsstChapters" ) {code} generates #titlebar( "Featured Content" "Go to the featured content section" "Main.FeaturedContent" "red" ) #featured_content_item( "Free High School Science Texts" "FHSST has posted segments of their open source science and mathematics textbooks for Grades 10 - 12 on Curriki. These books are the creations of a South Africa-based world-wide open source community." "Demo.fhsstChapters") #end_examplezone() 1.1.1 Module 4: featured partner {code} \#home_featured_partners( "fhsst" "FHSST logo 100.jpg" "Demo.fhsstChapters" ) \#home_featured_partners( "partner identifier" "partner logo - image from the Main.Partners doc" "full text link" ) {code} 1.1.1 Module 5: 1 column with blog post {code} \#home_news(nrOfEntries "Left title" "Right title") {code} If "Left Title" and/or "Right Title" are empty, the default texts are used (see the example below). #begin_examplezone() {code} \#home_news(2 "" "") {code} generates #home_news(2 "" "") ---- {code} \#home_news(3 "The news" "See all news") {code} generates #home_news(3 "The news" "See all news") #end_examplezone() 1.1 Page modules 1.1.1 Module 1: Advisors Used in [Main.Board]. {code} \#board_display_member("name" "link" "description") \#board_display_member_flag( "name" "link" "country" "flag image" "description" ) {code} where: * name is the name of the member * link is an internal link, to the page containing a detailed description * decription is a brief description of the member * country is the country of the member; it is not displayed, but used as an alternative text to the flag image * flag image is the imgage of the country's flag; must be attached to the document that calls the macro #warning("The macros generate table rows, so they should be used inside the <table class='board'></table> tags.") #begin_examplezone() {code} \#board_display_member( "Dr. Barbara 'Bobbi' Kurshan" "Board.Bobbi" "Member, Board of Directors and Curriki's Executive Director" )
{code} generates #board_display_member( "Dr. Barbara 'Bobbi' Kurshan" "Board.Bobbi" "Member, Board of Directors and Curriki's Executive Director" )
---- {code} \#board_display_member_flag( "Scott G. McNealy" "Main.McNealy" "United States" "us.gif" "Chairman of the Board of Directors and Founder Sun Microsystems, Inc" )
{code} generates #board_display_member_flag( "Scott G. McNealy" "Main.McNealy" "United States" "us.gif" "Chairman of the Board of Directors and Founder Sun Microsystems, Inc" )
#end_examplezone() 1.1.1 Module 2 1.1.1 Module 3 1.1.1 Module 4: 1.1 Panels 1.1.1 Navigation Panel The code for the [Panels.Navigation] panel must be structured as follows: {code} \#beginNavigationPanel() \#\# \#\# navigation panel content \#\# \#endNavigationPanel() {code} The \#beginNavigationPanel() Macro also generates the link to the *HOME* page. The entries in the navigation panel will be inserted using the two macros described below. {code} \#navigationCategory( "Category Title" "Category title link" expanded [ ["Sub-element 1 text", "Sub-element 1 link"], ["Sub-element 2 text", "Sub-element 2 link"], ... ["Sub-element n text", "Sub-element n link"] ] ) {code} where the third parameter establishes if the category is expanded by default, so it should be true or false, and all links are internal links. The "Category title link" can be empty (""). More details: #begin_examplezone() {code} \#navigationCategory( "About Curriki", "Main.About", true, [ ["News", "News.WebHome"], ["Staff Blogs", "Blog.WebHome"], ["Board", "Main.Board"], ["Leadership Team", "Main.Leadership"] ] ) {code} generates the "About Curriki" category and sub-elements in the navigation panel. ---- {code} \#navigationCategory( "Browse Content", "", true, [ ["Featured Content", "Main.FeaturedContent"], ["By Subject", "Main.BrowseSearch"] ] ) {code} generates the "Browse Content" category and sub-elements in the navigation panel. Notice the missing category link. #end_examplezone() {code} \#navigationTopLevelEntry("Entry Text" "Entry Link") {code} for menu entries witout sub-elements. {code} \#navigationTopLevelEntry("Entry Text" "Entry Link") {code} #begin_examplezone() {code} \#navigationTopLevelEntry("Donate" "Main.Donate") {code} generates the "Donate" entry in the navigation panel. #end_examplezone() 1.1.1 Featured Members Panel Sample code for the [Panels.FeaturedMembers] panel {code} \#panelheadercolor("Featured Members" "blue") \#\# \#\# List of Featured Members: \#\# \#displayMember("Bobbi") \#displayMember("jmarks") \#displayMember("RStephe") \#displayMember("XWiki.Flerp") \#\# \#\#
[$xwiki.includeTopic("XWiki.MemberCount") members>Main.WebHome]
\#panelfooter() {code} The \#displayMember() macro's parameter is the username of the momber on Curriki. 1.1 Browse Page 1.1.1 Macros {code} #transsubjectcard("translation_token" "" "") {code} example: {code} #transsubjectcard("promo_1" "Romeo Juliet" "__terms=Romeo Juliet") {code} Where

  translation_token is for finding the image URL and description text out of the translation page (XWiki.Translations) of the form
{pre}     browse.subject.image.translation_token=/URL_TO_IMAGE     browse.subject.description.translation_token=text to show under image {/pre}

{pre}   search to get count is for specifying the search on the browse page in order to get the count after the link. Can be:
  • simple terms - search anywhere in the document for the terms (needs to be prefixed with __terms= for URL)
  • XWiki.AssetClass.category:category_to_search_for
  • XWiki.AssetClass.educational_level2:educational_level_to_search_for
  • XWiki.AssetClass.fw_items:subject_area_to_search_for
  • XWiki.AssetClass.instructional_component2:instructional_compontent_to_search_for


  added to URL for search is for specifying what needs to get added to the search URL so that clicking on the link will go to the search page and bring up the appropriate search. In addition to the items for the search query above you can add:
  • __advShow=1 - Open advanced search
  • __go=1 - Assumed if __terms sent, not otherwise
  • __special=(mine|collections) - Which special filter to use
{/pre} 1.1 Group Masthead Use \#mycurrikiGroupInfo("Group_MiddleSchoolScience" "") to get #mycurrikiGroupInfo("Group_MiddleSchoolScience" "")
